meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>livelihood</kanji>. The verb version is <vocabulary>to live</vocabulary>. It's not really "to live" literally, though. It's more like <vocabulary>to live one's life</vocabulary>, rather than just to live.
readingMnemonic: If anyone is going <vocabulary>to live one's life</vocabulary>, it's gotta be the great <reading>Ku</reading>blai Khan (く). He conquered most of the world and was super badass.
